name: biomni-annotate-plasmid
title: Biomni: Annotate Plasmid
description: Annotate DNA sequences using pLannotate's comprehensive plasmid feature database
content:
Overview

This tool automatically annotates DNA sequences using pLannotate's comprehensive plasmid feature database. It identifies common plasmid features including promoters, terminators, resistance markers, origins of replication, epitope tags, and other functional elements by comparing the input sequence against a curated database of known genetic elements.

Input Parameters

  • sequence: DNA sequence to annotate (string)
  • --linear: Optional flag indicating the sequence is linear (default: circular)

Biological Use Case

Critical for plasmid characterization in molecular cloning:

  • Verify plasmid maps after receiving constructs from collaborators
  • Identify all functional elements in commercial expression vectors
  • Validate cloning products by confirming expected features
  • Discover unannotated elements in legacy plasmids
  • Quality control for synthetic DNA constructs before experiments
  • Generate comprehensive plasmid maps for publications

Output

Returns a parameters (plasmid_annotations.json) containing all identified features with their names, types, positions, orientations, and confidence scores.

Category

molecular_biology
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/molecular_biology/annotate_plasmid.py "${sequence}" ${linear} -o "${outputDir}"
